cab.content: DRAFT BILL TO mm THE GREENWICH HOSPITAL ACi 01l18z&,Admiralty Memorandum for the Cabinet.By Section 4 of the Greenwich Hospital Act 1872 (55 & 36 Viet,, ch.,37) the Admiralty are empowered to provide for the education and maintenance of daughters of warrant officers, non-commissioned officers, and.men, of the Royal Navy and Royal Marines? subject to the total number of girls being educated and maintained at any one time not exceeding two hundred, and to the amount expended on the education and maintenance of any girl not exceeding 4 the rate 01 20 a year,,The authorities of some of the schools to which girls are sent, have represented that under present conditions this sum of 20 a year is inadequate for the purpose, and have requested that tho amount may be. increased The contention is obviously just; and it is desired to amend the Act by removing the restriction referred to.The maximum number of two hundred is sufficient at the present time; but in view of future possibilities, it is desired to remove this restriction also,.The enclosed draft Bill, which has been settled by Parliamentary Counsel, is accordingly circulated for the information of the Cabins,(initialled) V/.
